1111.content:
It was a warm autumn day at the Canterlot Courthouse, but it was anything but typical. In the streets outside the courthouse, two mobs were rioting two very different sides of a high class case. Inside the courthouse was order, with the presence of the Honorable Judge Order, who presided over the defense and the prosecution. On the prosecution was the cold hearted unicorn Counselor who could not be named since it could endanger his life, who was going over notes and evidence. On the defense was one of the best lawyers in Equestria, Moonstone who calmly brushed his black mane and straightened his red tie, wanting to make a good impression as his client sat next to him.

His client was a short gray Pegasus stallion who was shaking in his seat, scared of the possibility that he could lose. If compared to Moonstone, the stallion was meek to his lawyer's strength that shined in the courthouse lights, along with his piercing red eyes. He was dressed in a cheap blue suit that clearly stated his lack of wealth, and wore small glasses that were slightly cracked on one of the lens.

The crime that the pegasus stallion was accused of was the murder of his wife.Both sides had argued their points for over a week and were about to deliver their closing arguments. Outside, the mobs were roaring their points, to kill the stallion as he killed his wife, or that he was innocent and being framed. But as the jury sat in their stand, the court and the mobs outside were silent, waiting for both sides to argue. The Counselor stood and walked in from of the jury, his plump face already turning red for his rant.

"Mares and gentlecolts, you are gathered here today to decide of this stallion's life. You have heard testimony that the accused was angry at his wife and that his feather was found at the scene of the crime. You have heard from the guards who found the defendant in the crime scene after the time of the murder. So ask yourselves, do we want a murderer put on the fine streets of Canterlot? Think of your families at home, do we really want the defense to let this stallion off easy for his sins against Celestia and Luna? No! So when you think about this stallion, remember that he will commit the act again, thank you." The Counselor wiped his face and sat at the table just as the Pegasus started to cry, smiling smugly at the certainty of the jury.

But that is when everything changed in the courtroom, after Moonstone slowly comforted the Pegasus, he slowly got up and walked to the center of the room with such power in his step that the room was a buzz with energy and his sharp eyes looked over everything from the jurors to the audience watching his back, then in a soft but firm voice, he spoke.

"I often find myself thinking back to my first time in this courthouse. It was the first time I felt the power of this courtroom. Unbiased, unprejudice... Fair." Moonstone stated as he looked up from his thoughts to find all eyes were fixed on him. "You have heard the honeyed words of the Counselor here, how my client was supposedly at the crime scene and how he was angry. He is deceiving you from the truth, that he heard earlier in this case. This Pegasus was truly in a flower store, buying his wife flowers for their anniversary, not leaning over her dead body. He has admitted to being upset with his wife before she was murdered, but can anypony say in this court room that their marriage has never had a rough bump? Not only that, but my client has no history of any crimes, while a previous suspect the Canterlot guard held had multiple counts of assault but was let go not only ten minutes after being caught."

Moonstone then faced the jury. "Now that you are presented with the truth facts of this case, can any of you say that this case is unbiased, unprejudice, or even fair? This case is a joke, made by the Canterlot Guards who know that this stallion is not the one who murdered his wife and let the real killer go free because of a bribe. I could not live with myself if an innocent stallion or mare goes into prison for a crime they have no committed. Could any of you?" Moonstone finished and quietly went back to his chair as the court was left shocked, of the court were both Princess Celestia and Luna who had watched the entire case from start to finish.

12311.content:
The sun had already settled behind the hills and gave away to the colors of the evening twilight. The snow plummeted from the dark clouds above, a relaxing, silent, magical, but lonely sight for Icarus to behold.

The streets of Poniville was incredible still. Everypony was most likely all ready inside there hollows, Icarus thought. As he made his way back towards his own, tucking his scarf tighter around his neck to ward off the cold, he heard a set of peculiar sounds. It was a cough, a sniff, and a sneeze.

But when he approached the noises, it became clearer, and the changling-pony pony could identify the sounds as one thing - somepony crying! He froze in his tracks, as of he was terrified.

On a bench sat a white-colored mare with a cherry-red mane. Her delicate noise was beet-red and every now and then she would sneeze, mucus flying out as well. Her eyes where bloodshot, tears spilling from them and soiling her pretty coat. She also shivered, but the cold seemed to be the least of her problems.

Her head perched up and she spotted Icarus staring at her. "Go away!" she exclaimed, burying her face in her hooves.

The changling-pony jumped, but he didn't obey what she said. He didn't know why, but he wanted to comfort this pony, figure out what was wrong and help her overcome this problem.

He approached her, slowly, careful not to startle her. "What's wrong?" he asked with the most gentle voice he could muster.

She was still sobbing, and Icarus was afraid that she hadn't heard him, but she suddenly stopped, lifted her head, and said without even looking at him: "My stallionfriend left me," she sniffed, "for somepony else. He told me that I wasn't worth it anymore."

The words struck Icarus; how could anypony be so heartless? To revise such a beautiful mare? He climbed up with her, shuffled closer, and folded his wing around the pony, blushing as he did so. She was startled by this action, but didn't recoil. In fact, she scooted closer, escaping the cold air.

They sat there in awkward silence until Icarus decided to break it; "So, my name's Icarus. and yours?"

"Cherry Mint"

Icarus smiled. "Nice name."

"Thanks," she said, a ghost of a smile appearing on her face.

"It's pretty cold out here," he said, "Wanna go to my place?"

The suggestion was a little too blunt, and Icarus was afraid she would refuse, but she nodded, much to his surprise. They left the snowy Wonderland and headed off towards Icarus' house.

And so a month passed: Heart's warming eve came and went and so did the new year. In those days Cherry Mint moved all her stuff from her house to Icarus'. It amazed the changling-pony that she had so little stuff; only a few bed covers and clothing.

Meanwhile, Cherry's belly began to show visible signs of pregnancy: it began to round out, inching closer towards the floor. She also had mood-swings every now and then and strange cravings, but it was nothing Icarus couldn't handle. He just enjoyed the fact that his house wasn't so empty anymore.

There relationship between each other strengthened also, blooming into love. Though, for some reason, they couldn't muster up the courage to share a bed.

But, ten spite all this, Icarus knew very well what he was; a changling hybrid, a freak of nature, and if Cherry Mint would discover this...

But he had nothing to fear if he just kept this a secret, right?

Everything was going well...until one day.

It happened after winter wrap up. A lot was done to clear the snowfall, and to reward everyone's hard work a annual fair was held.

Usually Icarus would have simply stayed at home (like he always did, not being much a fan of big crowds for obvious reasons), but Cherry Mint insisted they should go, claiming this was one of her most favorite event of the year, and he didn't have the heart to say no.

And so the changling-pony found himself in the hassle and bustle of the fair. He felt like turning into a rock to escape the little attention other ponies were giving him, but Cherry Mint brought him back to his senses as she darted from stall to stall, dragging Icarus along.

She wanted to play this game to win this stuffed animal, or she wanted to see this magic show. A good amount of bits were wasted on this day, but Cherry Mint and Icarus was happy.

It was late in the afternoon, and the duo were making there way back home. Icarus was carrying a small teddy bear, one of the few souvenirs they won from the fair today.

They were walking down the path, talking merrily to each other about the day's events, before a stallion suddenly stood in their way.

He had a yellow coat with a black main and tail, and his eyes were a sharp green color. He wasn't ugly, but he had a smug expression on his face that Icarus didn't like one bit.

"Can we help you?" the changling-pony asked.

But the stallion completely ignored him, walking past him and standing uncomfortably close to Cherry Mint, who only glared at him.

"Hey there, babe," he said with a grin."How ya been? I was thinking that you and I should get back together again," he finished in a seductive tone.

Icarus frowned in anger. Who was this brute? Why did he want to steal his mare away from him in plain view? Or perhaps he didn't know that they were in a serious relationship, that he was just a good friend. Still, he was very rude, and Icarus had half the mind to give him a stern telling-off, even though the stallion was a few inches taller than him, but his marefriend was already doing that for him.

"Get lost, Shiny!" Cherry Mint exclaimed, shoving past the arrogant stallion. "I already got somepony else."

She stood close to Icarus, indicating who this "somepony" was.

The stallion raised an eyebrow. "What? This guy?" he asked, looking amused. "He's a chump."

Icarus grinned his teeth. He was very close to lashing out to this pony.

"Shut up!" Cherry Mint said, "He's twice the pony you'll ever be. He's kind and helpful, and he doesn't leave his marefriend to fend for herself, especially when she's expecting."

The stallion looked confused. "What do you mean?" he asked

It was then that he realized how swollen his ex-marefriend's stomach was, and his eyes grew wide with shock.

"I-I didn't know," he stuttered.

"Of course you didn't," she said, her voice dripping with bitterness, "You ran off with that other mare and left me all alone. Well, here's a news flash for you, buster: I don't want anything to do with you anymore, and neither are you getting close to the baby when it's born."

With that Cherry Mint threw her nose up in the air and trotted away. Icarus had no choice but to follow. He glanced over his shoulder at the stallion that stood frozen in shock in the middle of the road, and he had a feeling that this was far from over.

154.content:
Ah, the chance of a lifetime!... For what? Let's see; there's few options we could play with in this setting.


The Awakening- Fluttershy has always been shy and timid, never able to speak her mind or voice her opinions well. But whenever she does try to stand up for herself, she always takes it too far. Her good friend Discord though takes note of that and decides to help her the only way he knows how: with magic! After spending time actually crating a potion, with the help of Zecora, he presents his friend with it, not knowing the ramifications of it. It seems to blanace her out at first, giving her confidence and a more relaxed tone... but why does she seem so much more wild at night? Is there something else going on that others can't see? And can anything be done at all? "Actually, is it that bad to being with?"

Remix the Remix- The past for Fluttershy had always been harsh, so much pain and loss scarred her memories. She lost her parents at a young age breaking her poor heart and leaving the mark on her in her submissive nature. Now, as an adult, she has tried to move away from it... until the nightmares start coming back. It was an off chance though, a simple spell miss-casted by her friend Twilight, that brought to the plane of the God of Time, Cronus. He gives her chance to change her past and she takes it... but at what cost? Why is living with in Cloudsdale still and... why are there so many different things in her life now? Just what all has changed from that one moment? And can it be undone? "No... This isn't what I wanted! Change it back!"

Never Smiled for Me- Fluttershy has shown to be the most forgiving of her friends and having a nack for helping others understand themselves. She assisted with the reformation of Discord, and through it, as been given cerdit as a wonderful counselor for those with anger, depression, and/or emotional issues. For this, after a recent capturing of the Changeling Queen, Chrysails, Princess Celestia has tasked Fluttershy with being in charge of her reformation. With a mystic collar on her neck that prevents the use of her magic, Chrysails is to learn her wrongs and repent, but can Fluttershy really help the Queen see the error of her ways? What if something expected was to happen to the two? "I'm not sure... but I'll do my best to help her."
